frameDefinitions: A Proprietor owns or runs a Business which provides a Product (which may be goods or services).
These are words referring to control by a Leader over a particular entity  or group (the Governed) or an Activity.
An Entity improves from a less desirable Prior_state to a more desirable Post_state.
A Whole separates into Parts, or one part of a whole, called Part_1, becomes separate from the remaining portion, Part_2.
This frame contains words that describe a set of individuals which possess some Commonality, generally a common attribute.
Two parties, the Exchangers, each give and receive from the other Themes.
frameExamples: The consumer electronics <t>company</t> Apple has exploded with popularity in recent years.
Sebek em hat was a <t>Leader</t> of Priests. ca. 1780 BC
This small channel meanders through marsh and wetland, <t>splitting</t> into several smaller channels that empty into Lake St. Clair.
They <t>swapped</t> the island with the Neapolitan government of the day for the much smaller Capri.
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Business</fen> identifies the company or establishment. This may be the target itself or the <fen>Business_Name</fen> if it is an appositive not set off with commas (i.e. restrictive):
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> in which the business is located.

The <fen>Leader</fen> is the one who has the role of leading.  With verbs, and with predicate nominals linking an individual to a <fen>Role</fen>, the <fen>Leader</fen> is usually the External Argument:

The role played by the <fen>Leader</fen> in a given situation, often an official title; incorporated in most noun LUsin this frame. When expressed separately from the target, <fen>Role</fen> usually occurs in a PP Complement headed by <ment>as</ment>.
The entity whose actions or beliefs the <fen>Leader</fen> directs in the context of a joint activity or movement.  This entity can be a political body, a person, or a group of people.
The <fen>Leader</fen> directs the <fen>Activity</fen>.
<fen>Time</fen> refers to the point in time that the leadership took place.
The locale from which the <fen>Leader</fen> leads the <fen>Governed</fen> or the <fen>Activity</fen>.
The object that undergoes change.
The time at which the improvement occurs.
The location where the Improvement occurs.
The <fen>Whole</fen> is a single entity or an aggregate of entities which separates into <fen>Parts</fen>.
This refers collectively to the Parts resulting from separation of a Whole:
Part-1 is the first of two Parts mentioned.
Part_2 is the second of two Parts mentioned. This is usually a PP Complement.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the separation occurs.
Where the separation occurs.

This role denotes the people in possession of the Commonality. This role is usually genetive, the object of a postnominal PP, or null instantiated (INI), and null instantiaton often implies the public at large, as in 'the common good'.
This role denotes an object or attribute which is jointly posessed by the <fen>Entities</fen>.
One of the possesors of the <fen>Commonality</fen>. Can be singular or plural.
One of the possesors of the <fen>Commonality</fen>. Can be singular or plural.

In cases where the <fen>Exchangers</fen> involved in a conversation are
construed as two separate groups with different levels of
volitionality or control, this role identifies the conversational
participant with greater semantic and syntactic prominence, as
compared with <fen>Exchanger_2</fen>. That is, <fen>Exchanger_1</fen> is generally
encoded as Subject, and peripheral FEs that do not make reference
to the event itself generally make reference to <fen>Exchanger_1</fen>. Thus
a <fen>Purpose</fen> (or <fen>Means</fen>, <fen>Depictive</fen>, or <fen>Manner</fen>) is construed to be that
of <fen>Exchanger_1</fen>, not necessarily that of <fen>Exchanger_2</fen> or the group
of <fen>Exchangers</fen> as a whole.

In cases where the <fen>Exchangers</fen> involved in a conversation are
construed as two separate groups with different levels of
volitionality or control, <fen>Exchanger_2</fen> refers to the semantically
and grammatically less prominent group. It is generally encoded
within a prepositional phrase (e.g. headed by with). Note that it
is possible for a single role to correspond to multiple referents.
For example, if the prepositional object in the example below were
plural, we would still assign it the single role <fen>Exchanger_2</fen>.

In some sentences both participants are expressed by the Subject, and there is no 'with'-phrase (cf example 1). In sentences like this, the Subject is assigned the role role <fen>Exchangers</fen>. In such sentences, the Subject always denotes more than one person, and it is understood that the reciprocal communication takes place between these two (or more) people. The Subject may denote two or more people either through conjunction, as in example 1, or through plurality, as in example 2, or by denoting a group, as in example 3. In each of these cases the role <fen>Exchangers</fen> is assigned. Notice that for nouns in the Exchange frame, it is possible for the <fen>Exchangers</fen> role to be expressed by a prepositional phrase as in example 4.
The item that begins in the possession of <fen>Exchanger_1</fen>.
The item that begins in the possession of <fen>Exchanger_2</fen>.
The items which change possession between the <fen>Exchangers</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the exchange takes place.
This role identifies the place where the exchange occurs.
listRoleExamples: The electronics <fex><t>firm</t></fex> went bankrupt.
Chris's business <fex>in Idaho</fex> is thriving.
<fex>King Hussein</fex> ruled Jordan.
Hussein reigned <fex>as King of Jordan</fex>
Cyprus Turks turn against <fex>their</fex> leader
The captain's cousin led <fex>the mutiny</fex>.
The general led his troops into battle <fex>on June 22, 1883</fex>.
He ruled the west <fex>from his palace in Milan</fex>.
Improvements <fex>in marketing techniques</fex> have since rendered it obsolete.
Her mood suddenly improved <fex>after sundown</fex> .
<fex>Metalworkers' union</fex> to split into regional divisions
These daughter chromosomes then begin to separate <fex>from each other</fex>, each moving away from the metaphase plate and toward one of the two spindle pole regions.
Initially, <fex>the front part</fex> separated from the rest of the body.
Initially the front split <fex>from the rest of the body</fex>
However it is believed they separated <fex>at least 2 if not 3 million years ago</fex>.
The two parts likely separated <fex>above the Atlantic</fex>.
<fex>Their</fex> common enemy was Britain.
Their shared <fex>parents</fex> were their only similarity.
<fex>He</fex> shares a home with us.
He shares a home with <fex>us</fex>.
The trade <fex>with Cuba</fex> went exactly as planned.
<fex>Smithers and Kornfeldt</fex> traded Pez dispensers.
I tucked the pistol between my belt and tunic top (how I wish I had kept it, but I later swapped <fex>it</fex> with a Canadian for some cigarettes.
The organization bought the property in 1999, then swapped it with the BLM <fex>for about 100 parcels in 10 counties ranging in size from one to 920 acres</fex>.
They swapped <fex>guitars</fex>.
